page.title: 03FARMOR'S SCHOOL, FAIRFORD
page.content: {Farmor's School}is a small comprehensive school providing secondary education for all children between ll and l8 years of age. Its catchment area includes the larger settlements of Fairford and Lechlade as well as about a dozen smaller ones. A full range of traditional subjects is taught and in recent years new subjects such as computer studies and technology have found a place in the curriculum. Music, drama, art and sport play a significant part in school life. Each year in July normal lessons are suspended for an Activities Week when residential courses both at home and abroad as well as school based ones are arranged There is an annual French Exchange. In the summer term next September's intake is invited to spend an introductory day at the school.
